title: Analysis: DOJ wants 'all' transcripts and evidence in House January 6 probe, Garland says
description: The Justice Department is seeking access to "all" transcripts and other evidence collected in the House January 6, 2021, investigation, Attorney General Merrick Garland said Wednesday.

title: Mysterious bright flash is a distant black hole devouring a star
description: An incredibly bright flash that appeared in the night sky in February was the result of a star straying too close to a supermassive black hole, meeting its untimely end there as it was ripped to shreds.

title: Prince William and Kate are in the US for their first trip in eight years
description: The new Prince and Princess of Wales touched down in Boston Wednesday ahead of the second iteration of the Earthshot Prize Awards later this week.

title: Jennifer Lopez reveals what Ben Affleck engraved on her engagement ring
description: In an interview with Apple Music's Zane Lowe, pop star and actress Jennifer Lopez opened up on her heartbreaks and second chance at love with husband Ben Affleck.

title: US considers dramatically expanding training of Ukrainian forces, officials say
description: The Biden administration is considering a dramatic expansion in the training the US military provides to Ukrainian forces, including instructing as many as 2,500 Ukrainian soldiers a month at a US base in Germany, according to multiple US officials.

title: What the Oath Keepers sedition verdict means for the DOJ investigation of Trump
description: A jury's willingness to convict two leaders of a far-right militia of seditious conspiracy for plotting to forcibly oppose the government is a major vindication of how the Justice Department is approaching its investigation into the efforts to disrupt President Joe Biden's 2020 win.

title: House committee receives Donald Trump's federal tax returns from IRS
SE Cupp: I have a question for Mike Pence
description: In this week's episode of "Unfiltered," SE Cupp looks at former Vice President Mike Pence's recent comments denouncing former President Donald Trump and why Pence won't go far enough.

title: Christine McVie of Fleetwood Mac dead at 79
description: Christine McVie, the singer-songwriter behind some of Fleetwood Mac's biggest hits, died Wednesday following a brief illness, according to a statement posted by her family on her verified Instagram account.

title: China entering 'new stage and mission' for Covid-19 controls, says official, following protests
description: China's most senior official in charge of its Covid response told health officials Wednesday that the country faced a "new stage and mission" in pandemic controls, state media Xinhua reported --  potentially indicating an adjustment to Beijing's "zero-Covid" strategy which has sparked days of nationwide protests.

title: Shanquella Robinson's death is being investigated as a femicide. Here is what it means
description: The killing of Shanquella Robinson is being investigated as a femicide, an unfamiliar term for many in the United States as this gender-motivated crime has not been defined by US legislation despite being a global issue.

title: Blinken: Russia's targeting of civilian infrastructure 'is barbaric'
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken tells Amanpour the United States is "very focused" on helping Ukraine with air defense, discusses the ongoing protests in Iran, and his upcoming visit to China.

title: Opinion: Why the Oath Keepers verdict is so significant
description: On Tuesday, Stewart Rhodes, founder of the right-wing militia group Oath Keepers, was convicted by a jury in Washington, DC, of seditious conspiracy for his role planning and orchestrating the January 6, 2021 US Capitol insurrection.

title: House Democrats pick Hakeem Jeffries to succeed Nancy Pelosi
description: House Democrats chose caucus chair Hakeem Jeffries of New York to succeed Nancy Pelosi as leader of the Democrats in the chamber next year, a historic move that will make him the first Black person to lead one of the two major parties in either chamber of Congress.

title: Australia stuns Denmark to book surprise ticket to knockout stage
Hugh Grant is right about 'Love Actually'
description: In many ways, Christmas as an adult is like Groundhog Day. You roll out of bed far earlier than you'd prefer, and for the most part, the 12 hours that follow are a comforting, but largely predictable rerun, of Christmases past: presents, shower, walk, food, sofa, TV. The same terrible TV.

title: Cameron Smith lifted aloft in pub as he celebrates home victory by watching TV replay
description: Jump into the crowd, watch back the replay, have a triumphant drink; there are many ways for an athlete to celebrate a big win.

title: Rome's fake 'gladiators' arrested for extorting money from tourists
description: Usually it's the tourists behaving badly in Italy, but this time three men accused of crimes outside the Colosseum are locals.

title: Blinken says Iran making 'profound' mistake in ignoring true cause of sweeping protests
description: The Iranian regime is "fundamentally" misunderstanding its own citizens by blaming outside actors for the protests raging throughout the country, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told CNN's Christiane Amanpour on Wednesday.

title: Home in Mississippi nearly split in half by tree from storm
description: CNN's Ryan Young reports on the severe weather that killed at least two and damaged structures across Mississippi and Alabama.

title: CNN begins layoffs in what CEO says will be a 'gut punch' to the network
description: CNN on Wednesday informed employees that layoffs had commenced, a move that is expected to impact hundreds of staffers at the global news network and mark the deepest cuts to the organization in years.

title: 'So relieved': Ex-wife of Oath Keepers founder reacts to verdict
description: Tasha Adams, the ex-wife of Oath Keepers leader Stewart Rhodes, joins "CNN This Morning" to discuss Rhodes' conviction of seditious conspiracy.

title: Drake gifts DJ Khaled four 'amazing' toilet bowls
description: Drake sends rapper friend toilets worth $20,000 each. No wonder DJ Khaled looks flush with joy. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Australia stuns Denmark to reach World Cup knockout stages
description: Australia stunned Denmark -- a team ranked 28 places above the Socceroos in FIFA's World Rankings -- to reach the World Cup knockout stages thanks to a brilliant goal from Mathew Leckie that secured a 1-0 victory.

title: House Democrats pick first Black lawmaker to lead a party in Congress as Pelosi's successor
All-women refereeing team makes history
ISIS acknowledges the death of its leader, announces his successor
description: ISIS acknowledged the death of its leader on Wednesday and confirmed his successor.

title: Opinion: This US victory is also a tale of unrealistic expectations
description: The United States' decisive World Cup match against Iran on Tuesday provided more than just the obvious clash of cultures between the longstanding political rivals.

title: Bad Bunny is Spotify's most-streamed artist in the world -- again
description: Maybe the year of the rabbit came early -- Bad Bunny was Spotify's most-streamed artist worldwide in 2022, his third year in a row.

title: US Women's National Team earns more from men's World Cup than own previous two tournaments
description: The United States Women's National Team (USWNT) earned more money from its male equivalent reaching the knockout stages of the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar than it did from winning its own tournaments in 2015 and 2019.

title: US considers designating Russian mercenary group as a foreign terrorist organization
description: The Biden administration is considering designating the Wagner Group, a Russian private military group, as a foreign terrorist organization amid ongoing efforts to impose costs on Russia for the Ukraine war, a US official said.

title: Richard Branson on the risk of starting a new airline in the '70s
description: Billionaire CEO Richard Branson talks to CNN about the risk he took when launching Virgin Atlantic in the 1970s.

title: Why the birthplace of Islam is hosting one of the world's biggest raves
description: Electronic music, strobe lights, glittered faces and hundreds of thousands of people in mixed-gender gyrations are all part of a new kind of ritual in Saudi Arabia that didn't exist just three years ago.

title: Musician Jake Flint dies just hours after his wedding
description: Oklahoma musician Jake Flint died unexpectedly over the weekend, hours after getting married, his publicist Clif Doyal told CNN.

title: 'We're not finished yet,' says USMNT's Walker Zimmerman ahead of knockout stages
description: After a 1-0 victory against Iran earned the US Men's National Team (USMNT) a place in the World Cup knockout stages, the players insist their campaign is far from done.

title: Bob Iger's biggest challenge at Disney: Finding the next Bob Iger
description: Bob Iger has a lot on his to do list in his second round as Disney's CEO.

title: 'Mind-control' parasites make wolves 46 times likelier to be the leader of the pack
description: Wolves are pack animals, living in family groups led by a matriarch and her mate. Some wolves stay with their pack their whole lives, helping hunt and raise pups like aunts and uncles as they mature, but others split off to find a mate of their own and start their own packs.

title: See China launch three astronauts to new space station
description: China marked a major achievement for its space program after launching three astronauts to its nearly completed space station. CNN's Kristin Fisher reports.

title: Buckingham Palace official resigns over 'unacceptable' comments to Black charity founder
description: An honorary member of Buckingham Palace has resigned and apologized after a Black charity founder said she was questioned about whether she was really British at a royal function on Tuesday.

title: Luka Doncić racks up 41-point triple-double to help the Dallas Mavericks beat the Golden State Warriors, 116-113
description: Luka Doncić racked up an incredible 41-point triple-double as his Dallas Mavericks beat Steph Curry's Golden State Warriors 116-113.

title: Explosion at Ukraine embassy in Madrid injures one person, officials say
description: An explosion occurred at Ukraine's embassy in Madrid, injuring one employee who was handling a letter, the Spanish Interior Ministry said Wednesday.

title: Fans around the world flock to watch Lionel Messi
description: Walk around Doha and it isn't long before you hear people talking about Lionel Messi.

title: Singer and music icon confirms relationship rumors
description: In a new interview with Vanity Fair, Billie Eilish opened up about her new relationship with boyfriend Jesse Rutherford.

title: Meghan and Harry faced 'disgusting and very real' threats, ex-counterterror chief says
description: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex and her husband Prince Harry faced "disgusting and very real" threats from right-wing extremists, a former counterterrorism police chief has said.

title: Consumers are keeping the economy afloat... for now
description: American shoppers just keep on spending, lending vital support to the economy. The question is: How long will it last?

title: Ellen Pompeo opens the doors to her Malibu weekend home
description: Ellen Pompeo still remembers swooning over the beach house the first time she saw it. There was something special about the modernist structure, perched on a blufftop overlooking the ocean in Malibu, California.

title: Lamborghini's last purely gas-powered supercar is a road car turned into an off-road monster
description: The Lamborghini Huracán Sterrato, officially unveiled in Miami Wednesday will be the Italian automaker's maker's last purely gasoline-powered supercar. It will also be unlike any Lamborghini supercar before because it's designed to go off-road.

title: Global 4-day week pilot was a huge success, organizers say
description: The verdict is in: A four-day work week is good for business.

title: EU seeks to set up specialized court to probe alleged Russian crimes in Ukraine
Inspired by tough love and true love, Lydia Ko is on top of the world
description: Last year, Lydia Ko's mother joked that she would retire if her daughter made it back into the top three of the women's golf world rankings -- a position the New Zealander hadn't occupied in over five years.

title: Iranian protesters celebrate World Cup defeat, as fears surround players' return
description: Iran's World Cup defeat to the United States was met by cheers and celebrations in Tehran and other Iranian cities on Tuesday evening, as protesters hailed the country's exit from the tournament as a blow to the ruling regime.

title: Russia's upper house of parliament passes tougher ban on 'LGBT propaganda'
description: Russia's upper house of parliament unanimously voted on Wednesday to toughen a controversial law banning what the bill describes as "LGBT propaganda," making it apply to Russians of all ages.

title: French bread gets protected status
description: Freshly baked news: the baguette, the long, crusty loaf bread that is a delicious staple of French life, has been awarded special protected status, placing it in a culinary pantheon alongside other regional food delicacies from around the world.

title: Leaders of New Zealand and Finland hit back at reporter's question on age and gender
description: As two of the youngest heads of government and among a small percentage of female world leaders, New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern and her Finnish counterpart Sanna Marin have long faced questions about their age and gender.

title: 'Living in despair and hopelessness': A lack of affordable housing can put people's health at risk
description: When Louana Joseph's son had a seizure because of an upper respiratory infection in July, she abandoned the apartment her family had called home for nearly three years.

title: Ukraine's First Lady meets with Queen Consort Camilla
Tiger Woods calls for LIV Golf boss Greg Norman to stand down
description: Tiger Woods has called for Greg Norman, the CEO of the Saudi-backed LIV Golf series, to stand down amid a rift with the PGA Tour.

title: No alcohol, no problem for many fans at Qatar 2022
description: • Fans around the world flock to watch Messi play in Qatar

title: China is planning an embassy in London on land with a royal past. Residents want King Charles to intervene
description: Residents of an apartment complex that sits on a historic parcel of land opposite the Tower of London want Britain's King Charles to buy it back, claiming that its current owner, China, will turn it into a hub for shadowy diplomatic activity.

title: World's best cruise ships revealed
description: The best new cruise ship of 2022 holds 3,099 guests and 1,506 crew. A 24-hour butler serves its most luxurious suites, and there's a three-level race track and slides that are 10-stories tall.

title: Watch highlights from Jiang Zemin's career
description: Jiang Zemin, the Chinese communist leader who paved the way for the country's emergence as a global superpower, has died, state-run Xinhua news agency announced Wednesday. He was 96.

title: At least 5 killed by Russian strikes in Donetsk
China's former leader Jiang Zemin has died, state media says
description: Jiang Zemin, the Chinese communist leader who paved the way for the country's emergence as a global superpower, has died, state-run Xinhua news agency announced Wednesday. He was 96.

title: Japan court rules same-sex marriage ban is constitutional, but activists see a silver lining
description: A Tokyo court ruled on Wednesday that a ban on same-sex marriage was constitutional but said the lack of legal protection for same-sex families violated their human rights, which plaintiffs welcomed as a step toward aligning Japan with other G7 nations.

title: Alzheimer's drug appears to slow progression in clinical trial but raises safety concerns
description: The experimental drug lecanemab shows "potential" as an Alzheimer's disease treatment, according to new Phase 3 trial results, but the findings raise some safety concerns because of its association with certain serious adverse events.

title: At least 5 killed by Russian strikes in Donetsk
Closing arguments slated to begin in 2nd rape trial against Harvey Weinstein
description: Closing arguments are expected Wednesday in the Los Angeles sexual assault trial against former movie mogul Harvey Weinstein, who faces two counts of forcible rape and five counts of sexual assault involving four women -- a model, a dancer, a massage therapist and a producer.

title: Protesters clash with police in China during new wave of demonstrations
description: Video from China shows new demonstrations in China with protestors clashing with security forces over the country's strict Covid-19 restrictions. CNN's Kristi Lu Stout reports.

title: Indian billionaire Adani's firm wins bid to develop vast Mumbai slum
description: The real estate unit of Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's Adani Enterprises has won the right to redevelop India's largest slum, Mumbai's Dharavi neighborhood, with a 50 billion rupee ($612 million) bid, a state official said on Tuesday.

title: In basement command centers all along the eastern frontlines, bookish Ukrainian soldiers direct artillery fire in a desperate attempt to hold off a Russian advance
Mother appears in New Zealand court over alleged suitcase murders
description: A mother of two children whose remains were found in suitcases earlier this year appeared in a New Zealand court Wednesday charged with their murders.

title: China's security apparatus swings into action to smother Covid protests
January 6 convictions bolster democracy, but McCarthy's defense of Trump threatens it
description: The American tradition of peaceful transfers of presidential power buckled in the horrific violence of January 6, 2021.

title: The best of Bali: What it's like to visit now
description: Like most major tourism hotspots around the world, Bali suffered vast economic turmoil during the Covid-19 pandemic. From more than 500,000 foreign visitors each month, arrivals slumped to double figures and tourism workers had no option but to try to eke a subsistence in the island's paddies and orchards.

title: US in knockout stages after nail-biting win over Iran
description: • Lionel Messi and Argentina face crunch game

title: CNN goes behind the front lines as Ukraine and Russia battle
description: CNN's Matthew Chance reports from the Bakhmut region of Ukraine, where Russia and Ukraine are involved in a bitter ground battle for the crucial territory.

title: US beat Iran in World Cup matchup. Here's why Iranians are celebrating
description: Social media videos show Iranians celebrating the United States' World Cup match win against their country. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh has more.

title: House January 6 committee chairman says panel 'close to putting pens down' on final report
description: The chairman of the House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol said Tuesday that the panel is "close to putting pens down" on its final report, which is slated for release by the end of this Congress.

title: A newly unsealed affidavit details the clues that led investigators to the suspect in Delphi teen girl killings
description: A .40 caliber unspent round that was found near the bodies of two teen Indiana girls was tied to suspect Richard Allen, who was arrested last month in connection with the killings, according to a probable cause affidavit.

title: Watch 'The Monopoly Man' transform into deepfaked Mark Zuckerberg
description: A tech-centric advocacy group, Demand Progress Action, released a video featuring deepfaked Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, thanking congress for their inaction on tech antitrust bills.

title: Kim Kardashian and Kanye West reach divorce settlement
description: Kim Kardashian and Kanye West have come to a divorce agreement, a source with knowledge of the negotiations tells CNN.

title: Twitter is less safe due to Elon Musk's management style, says former top exec
description: Twitter owner Elon Musk's dictatorial management style risks driving the company headlong into unforced business blunders, content moderation disasters and the degradation of core platform features that help keep vulnerable users safe, according to a former top Twitter executive who led the company's content moderation before abruptly resigning this month.

title: Ex-FBI Deputy Director on the message the Oath Keepers jury verdict sends to domestic extremists
description: Oath Keepers leader Stewart Rhodes and fellow group member Kelly Meggs have been convicted by a Washington, DC, jury of seditious conspiracy for their role around the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol. They, along with the other three defendants were convicted of obstructing an official proceeding. CNN's Brianna Keilar and panel experts discuss.

title: Bats use the same techniques as death metal singers to vocalize, study finds
description: Death metal fans might just have a new animal mascot.

title: Watch: An excited Biden returns to the podium to announce World Cup win
description: President Biden had just wrapped his remarks at a Bay City, Michigan chip manufacturing plant when he heard about the USA Men's National Team's win against Iran in the World Cup. See his reaction.
